title.value: Heterogeneous ensemble prediction model of CO emission concentration in municipal solid waste incineration process using virtual data and real data hybrid-driven
title.justification: The title captures the essence of the research which focuses on a novel heterogeneous ensemble prediction model for CO emission concentration, using both virtual and real data in the context of municipal solid waste incineration.
title.quote: Heterogeneous ensemble prediction model of CO emission concentration in municipal solid waste incineration process using virtual data and real data hybrid-driven

extractions.description: This research paper discusses a novel heterogeneous ensemble prediction model that integrates virtual mechanism data and real historical data. The model aims to predict carbon monoxide (CO) emission concentrations in municipal solid waste incineration (MSWI) processes, combining both machine learning and deep learning techniques. It utilizes a linear regression decision tree (LRDT) algorithm for mechanism mapping and a long short-term memory (LSTM) neural network for real data analysis. The models are combined through an inequality-constrained random weighted neural network (CIRWNN) for better prediction accuracy.

type.justification: The paper describes the development and validation of a new model using empirical data, such as virtual mechanism data and historical data.
type.quote: The proposed methodâ€™s effectiveness and rationality were validated through an industrial case study of MSWI process in Beijing.

name.justification: The research focuses on predicting CO emissions using ensemble modeling techniques, thus contributing to the field of predictive modeling in environmental contexts.
name.quote: This article introduced a novel approach: a heterogeneous ensemble prediction model that integrates virtual and real data.

name.justification: The paper uses machine learning techniques to establish the prediction model for CO emissions.
name.quote: As a result, utilizing artificial intelligence (AI) modelling methods to predict CO emission concentrations in MSWI processes based on historical data has become a practical and promising solution.

name.justification: Deep learning is employed in the form of the LSTM neural network, which is a crucial part of the modeling approach in this paper.
name.quote: a real historical data-driven model based on a long short-term memory (LSTM) neural network algorithm was developed.

name.justification: The research is applied within an environmental science context, aiming to reduce pollutants like CO from MSWI processes.
name.quote: Carbon monoxide (CO) is a hazardous gas discharged during municipal solid waste incineration (MSWI).

name.justification: This model is used for establishing the mechanism mapping model based on virtual mechanism data.
name.quote: a linear regression decision tree (LRDT) algorithm was employed to establish the mechanism mapping model.

is_compared.justification: The LRDT-based model is part of the ensemble process, which inherently requires comparison of performances among different models.
